wavelet.allsp

Function to calculate the wavelet variance curves for all species in one plot using quadrat indexation from CTFS package.

wavelet.allsp(censdata, plotdim = c(1000, 500), gridsize = 2.5,
  mindbh = NULL)

Examples

not_run({
  load("bci.full1.rdata")
  wavelet.variances = wavelet.allsp(censdata, plotdim=c(1000,500))
})

Contents

  • Examples

Author

Matteo Detto and Tania Brenes Output is a matrix with: scale: vector with scale of the analysis in meters; variance: matrix with the normalized variance at each scale (columns) for each species (rows); density: matrix with the density per area and abundance for each species in the plot; plotdim: plot dimentions parameter used; gridsize: grid size parameter used; UCL: vector with the upper confidence limit for the null hypothesis; LCL: vector with the lower confidence limit for the null hypothesis. censdata (): census data for the plot containing the variables gx, gy, dbh, status, and sp code; plotdim c(1000,500): vector with two numbers indicating the plot size; gridsize (2.5): gives the size of the quadrats for the rasterization mindbh (NULL): if analysis is to be done at different size classes

Developed by Rick Condit, Pamela Hall, Suzanne Lao, Kyle Harms, Mauro Lepore, CTFS-ForestGEO.

Site built with pkgdown.
